alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 12:55AM PDT until August 21 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern California, including the following areas, in southeast California, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chuckwalla Valley, Imperial County Southwest, Imperial County West, Imperial Valley and Salton Sea. In southern California, Chiriaco Summit, Joshua Tree NP East and Joshua Tree NP West. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Although the heavy rain has ended, there is a threat of excessive runoff and flash flooding through this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley; Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West; Salton Sea
